body.name: AOCHUAN Gimbal Stabilizer for Smartphone, iPhone Gimbal w/Focus Wheel Face/Object Tracking Gimbal for iPhone 15 14 Pro Max/Android Foldable 3-Axis Handheld Phone Gimbal for Video Recording -Smart XE
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 10 hrs 3 mins
features: Wide Compatibility: The gimbal stabilizer has a wide range of compatibility, Smart XE gimbal is compatible with all iPhone and Android phones under 7 inches, the weight of 0.62 pounds and the length of 6.3 inches, width of 3.5 inches, thickness of 0.4 inches. You can download our APP without the gimbal on your Apple and Google store by searching "AOCHUAN" to check if it's available on your phone or not, and discover all functions like Hitchcock, Inception, slow motion, time lapse, panorama etc...

Smart 7.0 Anti-Shake: Our gimbal uses leading anti-shake technology to provide professional anti-shake performance, which can eliminate shaking during movement and ensure that the photos and videos you take remain stable. Gimbal is suitable for any scene and captures every wonderful moment. The gimbal stabilizer for smartphone is equipped with a professional focus wheel and zoom slider, supports real-time and accurate focus and zoom adjustment. And also easily shoot professional portrait and landscape videos with the gimbal by one click

Smart Tracking 6.0: Our gimbal has a built-in tracking system that can accurately recognize and track. Face tracking, body tracking, object tracking and third-party live tracking four modes to meet your different shooting needs. Just click on the target object on the screen, the gimbal will automatically track and shoot, allowing you to take more creative photos. Moreover, the gimbal with gesture control function, capture your most creative shots effortlessly with intuitive gesture controls. Simply gesture accordingly, and our Phone gimbal will respond, ensuring you stay the center of attention

Fast charging and Long Battery Life: The gimbal is equipped with 2600mAh Li-Ion battery, charge for 3.5 hours and enjoy over 10 hours of shooting, this gimbal offers fast charging times, ensuring you to get back to shooting in no time, ensuring long-term outdoor shooting without worrying about the gimbal is out of power

Portable and Foldable: Our Smart XE gimbal adopts a foldable design, folded size is 6.4*4.3*2.1 inches, and the expansion size is 10.7*4.9*2.6 inches, and weight is only 0.77 pounds, 0.55 pounds payload. No matter where you go, you can put the gimbal in your pocket or bag at any time. Whether traveling or daily life, you can capture beautiful moments at any time. Package and Support. Includes AOCHUAN SMART X Pro gimbal (phone not included), tripod, USB-C charging cable and user manual. Each AOCHUAN gimbal is granted with 12-month return

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Por el momento bueno
reviews.reviewText: Llevo poco usandolo pero se siente la diferencia en los videos, la app tiene varias opciones de grabar, faltaria practicar mas para sacarle el mejor provecho pero se siente de buen material.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Aochuan Mobile Gimbal
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I got this gimbal because I am an avid mobile video shooter and this gimbal really really helped with my shaky videos as I do not have the most stable hands. With this gimbal, I actually feel good about my videos and now I can do all sorts of wacky angles and shots without worrying about the shakiness of it. Overall, I really recommend this gimbal for any mobile video creators!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not reliable and doesn’t work
reviews.reviewText: This product doesn’t work as advertised. Check the app reviews on the Apple Store for more details. It has a mind of its own and doesn’t do what it’s supposed to. I followed all the instructions and watched the tutorial videos. I cannot get it to function properly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Holds my iPhone nice and steady for videos.
reviews.reviewText: I don’t use this gimble like most people probably are .I am not making movies for creativity. I simply got tired of holding my phone sideways to record my child’s basketball games as I pan side to side when he runs up and down the court.This gimble mounted my phone and holds it steady so that it’s not so jerky when I am recording and it is way easier to hold the stick/handle of the gimble than to hold my phone sideways.The unit comes with a light for fill light, but I haven’t used it. There is also an app to download to help with different effects and the company has an instagram account for further instructions and tips/tricks.Compared to some of the other gimbles I was researching, this item is a great value especially for what my intended use is.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice gimbal/handle for smartphone for video filming / content creators, not that great as a stand
reviews.reviewText: So I'm not really a content creator or vlogger, but I've seen them out in the wild filming video with their smartphones using gimbals and I always wondered what the benefit would be, and I get it now after using this gimbal to film a little video here and there with my Google Pixel 6 - the added stability that using the gimbal provides when filming video just makes for a better less shaky, more professional looking video.It took me a little bit to figure out the setup, along with the included software, to use it well, but once I was able to complete that somewhat major hurdle, it was fairly easy to use, and the video I filmed just looks way better than when I was just holding the phone in my hands. It's definitely not a simple plug-and-play type of situation, and the instructions were a little unclear at first, but I think most people should be able to figure it out eventually. This is probably a starter/beginner level hardware with an intermediate level of knowledge required to use the app and it's functions.As hardware, this feels sturdy and pretty well made. It definitely doesn't feel like a cheap selfie stick or something like that, it has a semi-professional grade of quality. Lastly, trying to use this as a smartphone stand/tripod isn't great - it works fine but because the legs are so short, it's definitely a little precarious for more than short uses. But it works in a pinch and I imagine if I was travelling it could work vs carrying an extra stand. The included fill-light I think is for filming these type of close-up selfie/vlogging videos, which is a nice little addition, but limited use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product, but beware of thick cases!
reviews.reviewText: I am not a content creator, but I am a mom with kids in sports and now I can embarrass the heck out of them by being on the sidelines with my gimbal! Woohoo!In all seriousness, this is actually super useful at sporting events. I'm really impressed with the stabilization, as well as the ability to follow a face without creating a dizzying effect. I am definitely going to take it with me on vacation to record more memories.There is a learning curve here, especially if—like me—you're new to gimbals. There is an instruction booklet included but I still had to go online and watch videos to figure out what I was doing.One thing to be aware of: this is clearly NOT designed to work with any sort of remotely bulky iPhone case. (SHARPIE FOR SCALE so you can see how high up the grips go—I couldn't take a picture of my phone in it because...well...I needed my phone to take the picture. Lol.)I have a case on my iPhone 15 that I never thought of as excessively thick (though you can store 2-3 cards in it) and there is no way it would safely fit in the phone grip of this gimbal. I hate using my phone without a case because I'm worried about damage, so I wish I would have considered that before making this purchase.Still, I think this is an excellent starter gimbal and I am willing to use my phone caseless if it means getting to annoy my children. Ahh, memories.

I received the xe a week ago. I have played with it a few times. Seems to work great. I haven't yet done a full length video with it yet but worked well during some test videos. I love the tracking on it. You can set it up on the provided tripod or attach it to any tripod that has the 1/4 thread. I can walk around the room and always be in frame. So many other options to try out yet. But so far I'm loving it.

reviews.reviewTitle: Fairly decent 3-axis gimbal, case dependent, auto-tracking, gesture control, focus/zoom, app req'ed
reviews.reviewText: This is a fairly decent 3-axis gimbal that's reasonably well-constructed although it's mostly made of plastic typical of gimbals at this price point. It comes with a detachable tripod which I do appreciate and a magnetically attached RGB light that I don't really see the use case simply because it's not nearly and adequately bright for it to be useful unless the object is REALLY close to it; nonetheless, it's there should you have the need for it.The overall physical build quality is decent albeit typical of most others with similar design and style at this price range although it doesn't necessarily feel cheap but it's nothing to write home about either. It's made of mostly hard plastic and the look and feel in general is above average; the buttons and knob work reasonably well and smoothly without issues.Unfortunately, the phone clamp is its weakest point because it's NOT designed in such way that it could accommodate thicker cases or even phones additional 'accessories' at the back such as an expanding phone mount (aka PopSocket) or other types of phone holders/grips, foldable or not. This has drastically and negatively impacted the true usefulness of this gimbal because nobody (well, maybe somebody somewhere but I'm certainly not one of 'em) would care to remove the phone case repeatedly just to use this gimbal.I should also mention that the ONE reason why it wouldn't work, at least with the case of PopSockets is that the clamp MUST grip onto the phone in the middle in order for it to work properly and the reason for that is simply the motor isn't powerful enough to move the phone if the phone is attached to the clamp at one of the ends (i.e. not balanced). With that being said, this is not unique to this particular gimbal because most of these budget gimbals simply aren't equipped to hold a phone unless it's situated right in the center.It has a simple and yet typical design of controlling the various features and functions of the gimbal and no detail discussion is necessary since they are for the most part self-explanatory; however, I'll very briefly describe them but know that most features such as auto tracking, gesture control are only available with the help of the app (Aochuan) because it doesn't have a dedicated camera/sensor, and I'm not a big fan of the app for privacy and data mining reasons (but I digress).It has a joystick for pan and tilt as well as a button (left) for change the mode between portrait and landscape. At the left you have the focus knob and a zoom slide button below it. I should also mention that to my surprise the focus knob works pretty well and it's a neat way to manually bring objects into focus progressively.≡ ValueAll things considered, this is a fairly decent 3-axis gimbal for smart phones that's reasonably well-made and for the most part works as expected although the overall design of the clamp (and the motor in question) leaves something to be desired even at this price point. It's somewhat reasonably priced at $85 for what it provides, its overall build quality, usability, versatility, and performance. Your mileage might vary.
冬休みの旅行で使いましたが、本当にブレなく綺麗に撮影できました。ですが、若干スピードについていけないのか急な方向転換でエラーが出ることが何回かありました。普段から使い慣れているわけじゃないので長時間の使用はやはり手が疲れました（手が小さいので持ってるのも大変）。

reviews.reviewTitle: If you are new to gimbals watch AOCHUAN videos first!
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Firstly I am new to gimbals so please take this review with that in mind. I got this hoping it would improve my video taking game. I was surprised by how many features there are with this! I also can't believe this is considered an "entry" model. It's really got a lot of features going for it! One misconception I had was thinking the gimbal will stabilize the video from shakes. This one doesn't really do that but because of gimbal designs it does allow you the capability to take smoother videos. Hopefully that makes sense 🙂. Anyhow, I look forward having fun using this to make better videos!As a few other reviews mentioned, the instructions (or lack thereof) makes the gimbal a bit of challenge to use out of the box if you are a beginner. I highly recommend to watch AOCHUAN's YouTube channel. They provide a QR code in the instruction book. After watching the video I was able to install the app and connect my phone to the gimbal without any issues. It connects everytime, but may need a manual reconnect from the app should your phone go to sleep or you power off then on the gimbal. It's pretty easy.Another thing that may cause some "confusion", is the gimbal only has a few buttons but they perform multiple functions in some cases. For example pressing on the joystick selects different modes, double press power shows battery level, single click record changes starts/stops recording, and double click switches between portrait/landscape. AOCHUAN tried to make it easier by providing a cheat sheet on the gimbal itself.The gimbal uses a clamp to hold the phone. It's a nice design that tries it's best not to interfere with any side buttons of your phone. However, if you have a phone with a thicker case the clamp fingers may not be able to hold the phone tight enough. Your phone may pop out! You may have to take your phone out of the case, as an FYI.The gimbal is very compact. It can fold and secures closed magnetically. The gimbal also comes with a small tripod that can screw to the bottom of the gimbal handle. The tripod legs can also fold up to become a handle. This extends the existing handle if you want to use both hands to hold the gimbal. Additionally a small light is also included that can magnetically attach above or below the phone, facing either forward or backward. The light is really cool. For something so small it has a decent amount of light. It even does different color temperatures, and different colors! Oh, it's also rechargeable!!The gimbal motion is very smooth and silent. The joystick, depending on mode, can rotate the phone left/right, up/down or rotate it portrait/landscape. The speed of motion can be adjusted if you use the AOCHUAN app. There are lots of such adjustments in the app. The gimbal also has a knob to set focus (so you can fade in/out of focus) and a lever type switch to zoom in/out. Both these functions will only work with the AOCHUAN app. The app can also do face, body or object tracking! It works quite well! There is also gesture control so you can turn tracking on/off, etc. The app is really a requirement for using the gimbal to take advantage of all the features. Please be aware that AOCHUAN does collect some information if you are concerned about privacy, etc. I read most of the terms and they do collect more than what is shown in there Google Play store. This was a bit of a concern to me.I took some video moving the gimbal around. I found that when you sway back and forth there is a nice dampening effect. However I noticed it was a bit slow to rotate the phone around. There is also greater motion downward than upward as an FYI.You can use the gimbal with either left or right hand. I find it was harder to use my right hand as I could not comfortably reach the zoom lever. With right hand you can control the focus wheel with your index finger. If you hold the gimbal with your left hand both the focus wheel and zoom lever is accessible with your left thumb. But honestly I find it's just easier using two hands, one to hold and the other to turn the focus wheel, etc. The joystick, record button and power buttons can be easily used by one hand, either left or right.Battery life has been very good so far. After playing with this for a few hours the battery still shows 4 out of 4. The light unfortunately doesn't have a battery level indicator. It only has one LED showing power and as a charge indicator. Both the gimbal and light uses USB-C charging.Honestly I was very impressed with this gimbal. It is very well made with a good heft to it. Folded it is quite compact to easily take on vacation, etc. The magnetic light and tripod is very nice too. The AOCHUAN app is very full featured with face tracking, gesture control and many settings to adjust the gimbal. I just had a couple issues, the slower than expected rebound, depending how you hold it's easy to accidently hit the zoom, and lastly AOCHUAN app collects some more info than listed on Google Play (at least at time of this review). Over a very good entry gimbal.
